title: The Lib Dems and SNP have given Boris Johnson exactly what he wants
text:
When Conservative Party Chairman James Cleverly branded Liberal Democrat and Scottish National Party plans for a December 9 general election a “gimmick” on the Andrew Marr show, you could be forgiven for thinking such language a little premature.

Sure, there is an element of that in it. Agreeing to it would mean the prime minister abandoning his pledge to leave by October 31 — inevitable, at this stage, but a vaguely embarrassing admission of defeat all the same. The two opposition parties would no doubt revel in having made a liar of Boris Johnson; of winning a symbolic victory over him, and of having forced him to succumb to their own pressure. They would also be able to trumpet that a “No...
description: When Conservative Party Chairman James Cleverly branded Liberal Democrat and Scottish National Party plans for a December 9 general election a “gimmick” on the Andrew Marr show, you could be forgiven for thinking such language a little premature.
